p: You are invited to participate in a research study entitled "Investigating factors that play a role in interaction between manually driven and automated vehicles". The study is being conducted by Ruolin Gao (PhD candidate), prof. dr. Marieke H. Martens, dr. Pavlo Bazilinskyy, Eindhoven University of Technology, The Netherlands, r.gao@tue.nl.

You may of course always contact Ruolin Gao via r.gao@tue.nl, if you have any questions, or you can discuss this information with people you know. You must be at least 18 years old to participate. During this study you will watch videos about traffic scenarios and rate the experiences produced by the scenarios from a driverâ€™s view. Your eye movements will be tracked via your webcam, and from that infers where you are looking on the screen. There will also be a test exercise to calibrate the eye tracker to you and your viewing position before tracking can begin on your display. The exercise simply involves sitting in position and visually following a dot appearing at different places on the screen for a short period of time. We will NOT use the camera to observe or log anything else than your eye movements since for this study this is important for us to know. You will NOT be monitored via the camera on anything else than your eye movements and we will not record any video. The survey will take approximately 30 minutes of your time.

Your participation in this research project does not involve any physical, legal or economic risks. You do not have to answer questions which you do not wish to answer. Your participation is voluntary. This means that you may end your participation at any moment you choose by letting the researcher know this. You do not have to explain why you decided to end your participation in the research project. The information collected in the survey is anonymous. You will not be personally identifiable or contain confidential information in any research papers arising from this study. The data will be retained for a period of 10 years, and this study was assessed and approved by the ethical review committee of Eindhoven University of Technology.

If you have specific questions about the handling of personal data you can direct these to the data protection officer of TU/e by sending a mail to functionarisgegevensbescherming@tue.nl. Furthermore, you have the right to file a complaint with the Dutch data protection authority: the Autoriteit Persoonsgegevens. Finally, you have the right to request access, rectification, erasure or adaptation of your data. Submit your request via privacy@tue.nl.

If you agree to participate and understand that your participation is voluntary, then answer the question below with yes. If you would not like to participate, then please close this page. Before the study starts, the videos will be preloaded. This may take a few minutes depending on your Internet connection.
I consent to participate in this study in the way described in the information above.
Please do not use Internet Explorer for this study.
